pages.page: HAIR GROWTH LAB 14-DAY HEALTHY HAIR GROWTH MEAL PLAN NUTRITION FOR BETTER HAIR
HAIR GROWTH LAB TABLE OF CONTENTS 5 WELCOME DIET AND HAIR 7 USING THE PLAN SOME GUIDANCE 8 MEALS 1 - DAY 14 MEAL PLAN

HAIR GROWTH LAB Hi, I’m Sarah Tran, founder of Hair Growth Lab, an online haircare program where I help women resolve their hair issues so they can grow their longest, densest and healthiest hair. You’re probably wondering, how do I know so much about hair and why do I care so much about it? After a traumatising salon visit that left my hair breaking off like dust and shedding into bald patches, I became obsessed with figuring out how to reclaim my hair. But it wasn’t easy. With all the hair care misinfor- mation out there, I went through cycles of improvement and hair loss to improvement and loss again. I spoke to several doctors and specialists including chemists, nutritions, trichologists, endocrinologists to figure out what it really took to grow beautiful hair. And it was through ignoring mainstream haircare advice, testing and experimenting, and finally resolving my hair issues for good and coaching hundreds of incredible women to resolve theirs that we finally landed on the proven method for achieving our longest, thickest and healthiest hair. READY FOR A CHALLENGE? The quality of your hair is determined by the quality of your diet so one of the best things you can do for your hair is feed it the right nutrients. But it’s also the most challenging part too. This meal plan does the planning and research for you. Now it’s up to you to feed your hair well and let it shine for years to come. MEAL PLAN

ABOUT THE MEAL PLAN Each day of this meal plan is packed with the right balance of micro- and macronutri- ents your hair needs to grow out as strong and healthy as it could be. While each day caters to overall hair health, you’ll find that each day emphasizes nutrients for different hair concerns such as: • Hair loss • Thinning hair • Dry, itchy and sensitive scalp • Oily scalp • Graying hair • And many more! The best part of this diet plan is that you can mix and match and reuse recipes the way you like, and if you really don’t like something, you don’t have to cook it. However, if you want to get the most out of this meal plan, you should try to consume at least one breakfast, one lunch, one dinner and one snack per day, even if you do choose to mix and match the days. If you’re short on time, I suggest meal prepping as a way to get your nutrients in while minimising the time you need to spend cooking. Each meal is calculated precisely to give you the right amount of nutrients and a healthy amount of calories. The two most important nutrients your hair needs are the ones that help produce keratin and collagen in your body along with several vitamins and minerals which promote the healthy functioning of the hair follicle. These nutrients are abundant in the foods you will be eating for the next 14 days. Each day contains around 1,700 calories. You might want to increase or decrease the serving sizes based on you maintenance calories. You can calculate them using this site: https://www.tdeecalculator.net If you want to maintain your weight eat according to your maintenance calories. If you want to reduce your weight eat around 5% less and if you want to gain weight eat around 5% more. The meal plan also comes with a shopping list to aid you in buying all the ingredients you need to jump-start your hair-loving diet. You can mark off everything you already have at home and use the list as a guide to help you buy everything you need for your upcoming meals.
